bill_title: reauthorize the construction of nursing facilities on American Indian reservations under certain circumstances.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to reauthorize the construction of nursing facilities on American Indian reservations under certain circumstances. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That section 3 of chapter 180 of the 2003 Session Laws be amended to read as follows: Section 3. This Act is repealed on June 30, 2005 2006 . Section 2. That § 34-12-48 be amended to read as follows: 34-12-48. Notwithstanding the provisions of §§ 34-12-35.3 and 34-12-39.1, a new nursing facility facilities as defined in § 34-12-1.1 may be constructed, operated, and maintained in an area if the if each facility is to be located on an American Indian reservation and is required to serve a local population previously unserved through lack of nursing facilities within a forty-five-mile radius. No more than one such nursing facility may be located within the same American Indian reservation, and the number of beds in the nursing facility may not exceed fifty. The nursing facility shall meet the specifications of chapter 34-12 for a licensed nursing facility in order to participate in the medicaid program. 300 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.029 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
